summary:
At the moment I am specializing in the study of urban night, thus focusing on aspects such as nightlife cultural policies, the introduction of electronic dance music culture in heritage repositories, dance music historiographies, museum discourses of electronic dance music, and others. I am doing this both as a freelancer and as a member of the Amsterdance research group within the Amsterdam School for Cultural Analysis. Next to this, I am a member of the NachtIsLeven, a citizen initiative for a more diverse and inclusive night culture, supporting with policy advice on issues around space and inclusivity. Lastly, I am currently supporting the independent music venue OCCII with research and funding applications. 

Generally, I am a hands-on cultural project manager with a broad skill set, with previous experience in the fields of cultural heritage, policy development, area development, cultural programming and placemaking. I have worked with partners across more than 20 European countries, ranging from policymakers to cultural organizations, NGO's, businesses and artists.

treasury_media.title: StrandLAB Almere
treasury_media.description: StrandLAB Almere versterkt de culturele uitstraling van Almere. Dit doet StrandLAB door culturele initiatieven op en rond het Almeerderstrand aan te jagen en te zorgen voor samenhang. Op deze ontmoetingsplek van water, ruimte en avontuur maken kunstenaars en creatieve ondernemers het gebied voor iedereen aantrekkelijk en toegankelijk. Samen met de activiteiten in andere stadsdelen versterkt StrandLAB de stad Almere als aantrekkelijke woon- en werkplaats.

Drawing on the observations and results, the project will develop inclusive governance and management models for marginalized, non-touristic heritage sites and tests them in selected Cooperative Heritage Labs over Europe.

treasury_media.title: Innocastle
treasury_media.description: Mostly located in rural and remote areas, historic castles, manors and estates have the potential to stimulate rural and regional development and innovation. However, this requires a shift of paradigm in governance and support. Innocastle aims to influence more than 4 policy instruments affecting rural estates across four European countries.

projects.title: Innocastle
projects.description:
Mostly located in rural and remote areas, historic castles, manors and estates (HCME) have the potential to stimulate rural and regional development and innovation. However, this requires a shift of paradigm in governance and support. 
By developing new policy instruments to unlock these assets, HCME could act as drivers for job creation, better education, improving life quality and reducing social inequalities. 

The partnership of Innocastle consists of four European regions, each addressing one policy instrument: The National Institute of Heritage in Romania, the Province of Gelderland in the Netherlands, University College Ghent in Belgium and the Provincial Government of Badajoz in Spain.  National Trust from the UK is the partnership's knowledge partener. 

Eurodite initatied this project and is currently coordinating it on behalf of the Lead Partner, National Institute of Heritage Romania.

projects.title: Open Heritage
projects.description:
OpenHeritage: Organizing, Promoting and ENabling HEritage Reuse through Inclusion, Technology, Access, Governance and Empowerment

OpenHeritage aims at creating sustainable models of heritage asset management. The project puts the idea of inclusive governance of cultural heritage sites together with development of heritage communities at its center. This means empowering the community in the processes of adaptive reuse.

OpenHeritage works with an open definition of heritage, not limited to listed assets but also involving those buildings, complexes, and spaces that have a symbolic or practical significance for local or trans-local heritage communities. It starts from the assumption that abandoned or underused official and potential cultural heritage sites not only pose significant challenges for the public and private sectors, but also represent major opportunities.

The inclusive governance model calls for the incorporation of stakeholder coalitions (e.g. community groups, NGOs, local government representatives, small businesses and universities) into such processes, the integration of resources and the exploration of innovative financial models. In doing so, the transformation of abandoned cultural heritage sites becomes an opportunity for increased community cohesion and social integration, the appearance of innovative bottom-up economic activities and the creation of employment possibilities.

OpenHeritage identifies and tests the best practices of adaptive heritage re-use in Europe. Drawing on the observations and results, the project will develop inclusive governance and management models for marginalized, non-touristic heritage sites and tests them in selected Cooperative Heritage Labs over Europe. It works with communities, local businesses, local and municipal administration, tries out new forms of engagement and uses crowdfunding and crowd sourcing mechanisms to create active heritage communities.

projects.title: StrandLAB Almere
projects.description: StrandLAB Almere versterkt de culturele uitstraling van Almere. Dit doet StrandLAB door culturele initiatieven op en rond het Almeerderstrand aan te jagen en te zorgen voor samenhang. Op deze ontmoetingsplek van water, ruimte en avontuur maken kunstenaars en creatieve ondernemers het gebied voor iedereen aantrekkelijk en toegankelijk. Samen met de activiteiten in andere stadsdelen versterkt StrandLAB de stad Almere als aantrekkelijke woon- en werkplaats.

projects.title: Flevolab
projects.description:
Flevolab is een nieuw verbond ontstaan uit vijf belangrijke landelijk opererende cultuurinstellingen in Flevoland: 2turvenhoog (inter)nationaal platform voor podiumkunst voor kinderen van 0-6 jaar én volwassenen; jeugdtheatergezelschap BonteHond; theatergroep Suburbia; theatergezelschap Vis à Vis en culturele broedplaats StrandLAB Almere. Samen maken ze een grote stap vooruit om de ‘culturele zee aan ruimte voor talent en experiment’ in Flevoland duurzaam te ontwikkelen.

Missie
Flevolab is het (buiten)laboratorium van de Flevolandse cultuursector. Flevolab biedt disciplineoverstijgende begeleiding en faciliteiten aan cultuurmakers die zich bezighouden met vernieuwing vanuit onderzoek en experiment. Daarbij speelt het publiek altijd een belangrijke rol. 

Flevolab beschikt over unieke locaties én een landelijk en internationaal netwerk. De samenwerking van de partners zorgt voor een structuur onder nieuwe initiatieven waardoor deze duurzaam worden en blijven. Door de bundeling van kennis en ervaring op specifieke terreinen en disciplines, is er sprake van sectoroverstijgende begeleiding en ontstaat ruimte voor nieuw initiatief. De continue dialoog tussen onze makers en het publiek geeft ons een beter bereik en een betrokken publiek.

Visie 
Kunstenaars fungeren als onderzoekers voor de samenleving. Kunst helpt om Flevoland verder te ontwikkelen: voor zowel zijn bewoners, de omgeving en de maatschappij. Om kunst tot grote hoogte te laten stijgen en te kunnen laten reflecteren op de gehele samenleving en urgente vraagstukken, is er een plek nodig voor het experiment, voor ontwikkeling en ook voor af en toe een mislukking. Die plek is Flevolab.

Flevolab bundelt de krachten, deelt de kennis en ervaring en betrekt de vijf partners actief bij onderzoek, ontwikkeling en experiment. Zo scheppen we nieuwe relaties en groeien we uit tot dé landelijke plek waar nieuwe makers heen willen om te experimenteren en creëren mét en vóór het publiek.

profile_positions.description:
OCCII is an independent music venue that is primarily volunteer-run. It is a unique social center in Amsterdam, driven by a do-it-yourself attitude, and a home for subversive, experimental and extreme music and cultural programmes. 

I am currently supporting OCCII in developing a funding application for the AfK (Amsterdam Fonds voor de Kunst) for the period 2025-2029. In preparation for that, I am also supporting OCCII in audience research, measuring volunteer satisfaction, and increasing inclusivity and diversity in their programmes through discussions with booking agents and programme makers.
profile_positions.title: Research & Subsidy Application

profile_positions.description:
I worked as project manager of Innocastle, an Interreg Europe funded project aiming to improve policy instruments affecting heritage in 5 European regions. The project partnership is made up of the National Heritage Institute in Romania, the Province of Gelderland in the Netherlands, HOGENT in Belgium, Diputacion de Badajoz in Spain and the National Trust in the UK. I supported Eurodite in writing the funding application for the project. Read more: www.interregeurope.eu/innocastle 

Moreover, I supported Eurodite as a researcher for Open Heritage, a Horizon2020 funded project looking at exemplary adaptive reuse heritage projects in Europe which empower local communities. The project aimed to create tools to support European sites which dive into the process of transformation of buildings and areas. Read here the reports I wrote about the transformation of the Halele Carol site in Bucharest, Romania and the Marineterrein in Amsterdam, the Netherlands: https://openheritage.eu/2020/01/15/introducing-the-observatory-cases/ 

Lastly, I supported Eurodite in writing grant applications on topics related to leisure, with a specific focus on heritage and creative industries, as well as in the executive administration of the Romanian headquarters.
profile_positions.title: Project Manager

profile_positions.description:
FlevoLAB is a collaboration between five important cultural institutions in the province of Flevoland: 2turvenhoog organising performing arts and visual arts for young children and toddlers, youth theater company BonteHond, theater group Suburbia, theater company Vis à Vis and broedplaats StrandLAB Almere. Together they are uniting to develop the cultural infrastructure of the province, in order to support new talents and to bring culture closer to all inhabitants in the Flevoland. 

After obtaining funding for four years to develop this collaboration from the Ministry of Culture and the Province of Flevoland, I was contracted to give form to the collaboration by developing a work plan, budget and cooperation guidelines. I led the process of developing these products together with representatives from all the organizations involved, the Province of Flevoland and other relevant stakeholders within the province.
profile_positions.title: Coordinator FlevoLAB

profile_positions.description:
Linkeroever gives buildings and areas meaning and energy.
Call it transformation, development or (re)vitalization, the result will be a place with new energy and a clear direction, which contributes to the society and its direct surroundings.

I have supported Linkeroever in setting up the area development project StrandLAB Almere, commissioned by the Municipality of Almere. I have done market research, contributed to strategy development, organized different events as part of the transformation strategies, developed a social media communication strategy, supported various tasks within the marketing and communication department such as developing a website, printed materials, periodic newsletters, developed and updated a stakeholder map showing the progress of the initiative in obtaining community support, supported in the applications for additional funding, etc.
profile_positions.title: Researcher

profile_positions.description:
- developing and implementing a communication strategy
- establishing an online presence on Facebook, Instagram and via newsletter (mailchimp)
- improving the SEO of the website
- market research
profile_positions.title: Communication Expert

profile_positions.description:
My assignment was to create a user base growth strategy for Artconnect, by designing a gamified framework for the platform. Moreover, I did a market evaluation on existent business models for selling art online and formulated a strategy catered to Artconnect's needs.  

My daily tasks were related to acquiring and maintaining partnerships, as well as promoting Artconnect at various art events in Berlin.

All the articles written during my period at Artconnect can be found at http://blog.artconnect.com/author/alinatomescu/
profile_positions.title: Public Relations Assistant & Blogger

profile_positions.description:
My daily tasks within the Social Media department were to select content for, create & schedule (using hootsuite) 60-80 posts a week on Facebook, Twitter, G+, Tumblr, Pinterest and Instagram. I also set up the weekly newsletter using MailChimp, did live posting from several art events in Berlin every week and maintained all the interaction with followers.

While working in the Social Media department, I had to come up with new strategies to involve users and to raise user engagement. 

Moreover, I have also done client work for Artconnect's creative agency, developing online communication strategies for musicians: Hauschka, AWVFTS, Dustin O'Halloran and Jóhann Jóhannsson.
profile_positions.title: Social Media Coordinator

volunteer_experiences.description:
NACHT=LEVEN is a citizen campaign for a diverse and inclusive night culture in Amsterdam. We demand more space (in a physical, financial, legal and social sense) for the night. https://actie.degoedezaak.org/petitions/red-de-amsterdamse-nacht

The group serves as an advisory body to the Night Council and the Night Mayor of Amsterdam. Activities include public surveys about nightlife issues, developing policy recommendations, providing feedback on policy documents developed by the Municipality of Amsterdam in regard to night culture, etc. My role is to support especially in the fields of urban development and inclusivity.
